Articles.Content: So you just talked about removing mod dependencies the other day.  So are we assuming this is a built-in replacement for Deep Freeze?

> So you just talked about removing mod dependencies the other day.  So are we assuming this is a built-in replacement for Deep Freeze?
> 

More a side effect that came along for the ride for something else I was working on ![:)](//s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/kerbal-forum-uploads/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Ran into a little bug with the new Inventory System. My Crew got Grouchy from missing Habitation space from Travelling to a Station. Once at the Station, they become Normal again, but lost their Inventory (EVA Science pack and Jetpack).

Its fun trying to catch a free floating Kerbal with a big Stations :O

I'll just assume it is either a stock bug, or they got frustrated and threw their belongings out of the airlock ![:D](//s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/kerbal-forum-uploads/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I use all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> stuff and I tried both <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> and TAC life support. I decided to stay on TACLS but while I was on <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> there was an option "Start Habitat" on modules and I think this is part of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> life support habitats make Kerbals feel comfortable etc. right?

The only reason I kept TAC because I liked the parts better, slim and more streamlined. But I didn't know about "grouchy" feature, maybe I want to torture myself and make the game even harder...   

Others who tried both? Is it better or harder?  

For the moment I have 2 missions and a Satellite Station with TAC life support which I monitor for supplies. If I change to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> means I will have to make sure habitats are on? Anything else?  

**Edited <time datetime="2021-01-17T23:26:00Z" title="01/17/2021 11:26  PM" data-short="3 yr">January 17, 2021</time> by alphaprior**

TAC LS and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS are not very interchangeable. 

TAC LS uses distinct supplies like Oxygen & Carbon Dioxide that will be familiar to you, while <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS bundles everything into "Supplies", which kerbals use at a rate of ~10/day. <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS also uses a habitation & home timer. Basically:

- The home timer indicates how long before the Kerbal wants to go home
- The habitation timer indicates how long the Kerbal will be willing to stay on board their current base/ship for
- Timers can go up if they move somewhere more comfortable
- Habitats ("Start Habitat") increases the maximum habitation / home time
- Some habitats add months to a number of kerbal's hab/home timers (e.g. add rooms for kerbals)
- Some habitats multiply the months for a number of kerbals (i.e. multiply the effectiveness of those rooms)

That's not entirely accurate, but you can read more on habitation / home [here](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/wiki/Quick-Start:-Habitation) and supplies [here](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/wiki/Quick-Start:-Supplies).

If you switch to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS you'll need to ensure you have "Supplies" and enough habitation (habitats) available on each ship/base/station that has Kerbals on it. They're not so easily swappable, I'm afraid. Also be aware that removing TAC LS (and it's parts) may break existing craft, and using both TAC LS and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS together may have unforeseen (bad) consequences. 

If you're a stickler for punishment, you can configure <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> to choose the severity of the consequences when Kerbals run out of supplies!

Hmm ok for the moment it's good that I use TAC LS because I have 2 long missions Eve & Duna, they are already huge ships with command modules and a lab, comforts was not an option. When they return I will have lots of tech points and will get better techs then I can move to <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> life support.

i have a memory of someone reporting using USILS for the HAB and TAC for the suplays  

IIRK ther wer no bad collisions.  

thers probably options you can set so you can use it in a way that will fit you.

Please do an IVA for the Orca!

That Command capsule is amazing and I use it all the time!

So a few things.

The Orca isn't part of this mod.

[@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) hasn't been shy about his feelings on the tedious nature of IVA's and the amount of work for what you get.  So I wouldn't hold my breath.

He also loves pull requests, so if you felt the desire to learn how to make one, he'd be happy to include it.

I have started a new playthrough, and I'm having a "problem".  Electrical charge and supplies doesn't seem to be draining, once warp goes about 100x, which kinda defeats the purpose of having a life support mod.  I'm using Parallax, Scatterer, a bunch of Nertea's mods, MKS and USL LS. Any ideas what could be causing this?

EDIT: It seems to come from Nerteas Dynamic Battery Storage mod, and that its a compatibility issue.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-01-22T20:23:31Z" title="01/22/2021 08:23  PM" data-short="3 yr">January 22, 2021</time> by Sokar408**

I return because unlike what I said earlier, Nertea's mod does not seem to be responsible after all. Before I start tearing my install apart (again), can you [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) confirm that the 0.01 electrical charge drain of single Kerbal, should continue beyond warp speed 100x?

Scaling of EC consumption in timewarp for unpacked vessels is a stock thing since <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS is basically a stock resource converter.  This is to prevent battery overrun in a single tick at high warp.

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> Scaling of EC consumption in timewarp for unpacked vessels is a stock thing since <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> LS is basically a stock resource converter.  This is to prevent battery overrun in a single tick at high warp.
> 

Not sure I understand. What happens for me, is that a vessel with just the starter capsule and 1 kerbal, have the EC drains 0.01 -> 0.05 -> 0.10 -> 0.5 -> 1 -> 0.01 as warp goes from 1x -> 5x -> 10x -> 50x -> 100x -> 1000x.  

Notice that the EC drain basically resets to run in real time, instead of warp time, but ONLY at 1000x and above. It this desired behavior?

EDIT: Having removed all mods except USL LS this still happens. It does NOT happen with other types of EC drain however! It is only the Kerbal drain that has this weird behavior at and passed 1000x.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-01-24T12:15:15Z" title="01/24/2021 12:15  PM" data-short="3 yr">January 24, 2021</time> by Sokar408**

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Sokar408 said:
> 
> 
> Not sure I understand. What happens for me, is that a vessel with just the starter capsule and 1 kerbal, have the EC drains 0.01 -> 0.05 -> 0.10 -> 0.5 -> 1 -> 0.01 as warp goes from 1x -> 5x -> 10x -> 50x -> 100x -> 1000x.  
> 
> Notice that the EC drain basically resets to run in real time, instead of warp time, but ONLY at 1000x and above. It this desired behavior?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> EDIT: Having removed all mods except USL LS this still happens. It does NOT happen with other types of EC drain however! It is only the Kerbal drain that has this weird behavior at and passed 1000x.
> 

Yep, what you are seeing is correct behavior for a stock resource converter under warp.  You'd see the same with an <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> or drill.

> 
> 
> Just now, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> Yep, what you are seeing is correct behavior for a stock resource converter under warp.  You'd see the same with an <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr> or drill.
> 

God damnit I have spent at least a good few hours trying to fix the stock game.  Thanks for the clarification.

What happens with water? I have 2 tanks with 600lt of water each and in just few days they get empty! How much water Kerbals need? It's a space station with several modules with habitat mode on. I had greenhouse to produce supplies and turned it off.  

I have K&K water purifier and oxygen regenerator turned on. Also RT-500 recycling module turned off.

There were 10 Kerbals on station now 7 and 0 water!

> 
>

>

> What happens with water? I have 2 tanks with 600lt of water each and in just few days they get empty! How much water Kerbals need? It's a space station with several modules with habitat mode on. I had greenhouse to produce supplies and turned it off.

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS does not use water natively.  Sounds like your answer lies in a different mod.
